questions.question: She works ……………………….. a receptionist.
questions.description: As is used to talk about the role a person performs.

questions.question: They fought ……………………… lions.
questions.description: Like is a preposition it is followed by a noun as is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: ……………………….. you know, we cannot promote inefficiency.
questions.description: Like is a preposition it is followed by a noun as is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: She sings …………………………. a cuckoo.
questions.description: Like is a preposition it is followed by a noun as is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: When she heard the news, she cried …………………………. a baby.
questions.description: Like is a preposition it is followed by a noun as is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: …………………………. his father, he does not smoke.
questions.description: Like is a preposition it is followed by a noun as is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: ………………………. I am his father, it is my duty to protect him.
questions.description: Like is a preposition it is followed by a noun as is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: That cloud looks ……………………….. a cat.
questions.description: Like is a preposition it is followed by a noun as is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: Animals …………………………. lions, tigers and wolves are carnivores.
questions.description: Like is a preposition it is followed by a noun as is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: I felt …………………………… crying.
questions.description: I felt like crying means I wanted to cry.

questions.question: He arrived just ………………………… we were about to go.
questions.description: Just as is used to talk about two actions that happen simultaneously.

questions.question: ………………………… you don’t like it, I won’t do it.
questions.description: Like is a preposition it is followed by a noun as is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: He is ............................... my own father to me.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before a noun or pronoun. As is a conjunction. It is used before a clause or a preposition. It is also used to say what function or role a person has.

questions.question: ............................. his father, he does not smoke.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before a noun or pronoun. As is a conjunction. It is used before a clause or a preposition. It is also used to say what function or role a person has.

questions.question: It looks ............................... a hare.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before a noun or pronoun. As is a conjunction. It is used before a clause or a preposition. It is also used to say what function or role a person has.

questions.question: She works ............................. a clerk in a department store.
questions.description: As can be used as a preposition to say what function or role a person or thing has.

questions.question: He fought ............................... a lion.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before a noun or pronoun. As is a conjunction. It is used before a clause or a preposition. It is also used to say what function or role a person has.

questions.question: Why are you eating ............................. a bird?
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before a noun or pronoun. As is a conjunction. It is used before a clause or a preposition. It is also used to say what function or role a person has.

questions.question: He works ............................ a dog still, he does not earn much.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before a noun or pronoun. As is a conjunction. It is used before a clause or a preposition. It is also used to say what function or role a person has.

questions.question: She is regarded ............................ the greatest thinker of our times.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before a noun or pronoun. As is a conjunction. It is used before a clause or a preposition. It is also used to say what function or role a person has.

questions.question: Don't use your nail ............................ a screwdriver.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before a noun or pronoun. As is a conjunction. It is used before a clause or a preposition. It is also used to say what function or role a person has.

questions.question: He runs a small start-up. ............................... a budding entrepreneur he has to work really hard.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before a noun or pronoun. As is a conjunction. It is used before a clause or a preposition. It is also used to say what function or role a person has.

questions.question: Just ............................ his dad, he is a doctor.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before a noun or pronoun. As is a conjunction. It is used before a clause or a preposition. It is also used to say what function or role a person has.

questions.question: She is as beautiful ............................... a doll.
questions.description: The correct expression is as...as...

questions.question: She is as beautiful ………………………. an angel.
The jewels shone ……………………….. stars.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before nouns.

questions.question: She talks …………………………. a scholar.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before nouns.

questions.question: They were fighting …………………………….. dogs.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before nouns.

questions.question: .................................. responsible citizens, we should abide by the rules and regulations.
She looks ……………………….. Princess Diana.
questions.description: Like is a preposition. It is used before nouns.

questions.question: It looks ................................... it is starting to rain.
questions.description: Like is possible here in an informal style.

questions.question: She talks .................................... she is rich.
questions.description: As if is used to say how a particular situation seems like.

questions.question: He sat there crying .................................... he had lost everything.
